name: Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phases 1 and 2  Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the name of the government organization headed by Nick Fury in "The Avengers" (2012) that was responsible for keeping track of alien threats and helped to recruit the Avengers?
questions.explanation:
SHIELD.

	SHIELD, which stands for "Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division", was created when Hydra fell after World War II. In "Captain America: The Winter Soldier" (2014), Hydra emerged after years in the shadows and brought down SHIELD.

questions.text: Which superhero was played by two different actors in the first two phases of the MCU?
questions.explanation:
Hulk.

	Bruce Banner's Hulk was played by Edward Norton in "The Incredible Hulk" (2008) and by Mark Ruffalo in "The Avengers" (2012) and "The Avengers: Age of Ultron" (2015).

questions.text: In "Ant Man" (2015), How did Hank Pym really lose his wife?
questions.correct: She went subatomic to save everyone.
options: She died in a plane crash.
questions.explanation:
She went subatomic to save everyone.

	Hank Pym, the original Ant Man, lied to his daughter for years that his wife died in a plane crash. In reality, she went subatomic in the Wasp suit to destroy a missile and became stuck in the quantum realm. The new Ant Man, Scott Lang, was the first to visit the quantum realm and return.

questions.text: Which of the following movies was the first in the MCU to not contain a battle located on Earth?
questions.explanation:
Guardians of the Galaxy.

	"Guardians of the Galaxy" (2014) introduced characters such as Star Lord, Groot, and Rocket Raccoon to the MCU. In this movie, several comedic criminals band together to stop the destruction of a world and secure an infinity stone. Earth was seen briefly in the movie, but only in a flashback of Star Lord's past.

questions.text: The death of which SHIELD agent sparked the Avengers' emotions and rallied them to fight as a team in "The Avengers" (2012)?
questions.explanation:
Phil Coulson.

	Agent Coulson's death was not taken well by some Marvel fans, but he did not stay dead for long. In 2013 Marvel and ABC released season 1 of "Agents of SHIELD", a TV show in which Coulson was brought back to life and secretly operated as an agent. After the events of "Captain America: The Winter Solider" (2014), director Nick Fury went into hiding and made Coulson the new director.

questions.text: What "romantic gesture" did Tony Stark make at the end of "Iron Man 3" (2013) to show his girlfriend Pepper Potts that he was dedicated to her?
questions.correct: Blew up all of the Iron Man suits
options: Blew up all of the Iron Man suits
questions.explanation:
Blew up all of the Iron Man suits.

	This gesture did not last for long. Iron Man was back in "Avengers: Age of Ultron" in 2015. In fact, Tony Stark, with the help of Bruce Banner (The Hulk) was ultimately responsible for creating Ultron. This event, and The Hulk's inability to control is rage, caused Bruce Banner to run away from the other Avengers.

questions.text: What is the name of Thor's brother who caused quite a disturbance in the MCU?
questions.explanation:
Loki.

	Loki is actually Thor's adopted brother and the son of the ruler of the Frost Giants. Loki's presence was felt by Earth when he opened a portal above New York to a Centaurian invasion in "The Avengers" (2012). In "Thor: The Dark World" (2013), Loki faked his own death, and was shown at the end of the movie to be impersonating Thor's father as the king of Asgard.

questions.text: In "The Avengers: Age of Ultron" (2015), which city must the heroes stop from falling out of the sky?
questions.explanation:
Sokovia.

	The creation of Ultron and the attack on Sokovia killed a lot of people in this movie, causing citizens of the world to lose trust in their superheroes. In "Captain America: Civil War" (2016, Phase 3), The Sokovia Accords were passed to control the Avengers' actions.

questions.text: Which purple villain appeared in both "The Avengers" (2012) and "The Avengers: Age of Ultron" (2015) end credit scenes, and appeared in "Guardians of the Galaxy" (2014)?
questions.explanation:
Thanos.

	Thanos did not have much of a presence in the first two phases of the MCU. In "Guardians of the Galaxy" (2014), it was revealed that Thanos had a daughter named Gamora working against him. In the end credit scene of "The Avengers: Age of Ultron" (2015), Thanos was seen putting on his Infinity Gauntlet and saying, "I will do it myself".

questions.text: Which MCU movie franchise became a trilogy by phase two?
questions.explanation:
Iron Man.

	During the first two phases of the MCU, Robert Downey Jr. appeared in five movies. Other than the "Iron Man" movies, he appeared in "The Avengers" (2012), "The Avengers: Age of Ultron" (2015), and at the end of "The Incredible Hulk" (2008). His character was also referenced in other movies and TV shows such as "Agents of SHIELD".
